definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Today is the day my brother gets married.
sentences.chinese: 今天是哥哥和嫂子结缡的大喜日子。

sentences.english: Uncles son thought that his wife to her meal delivery to people , and ate.
sentences.chinese: 小姑子还以为是自己嫂子让人给她送饭来的，就吃了。

sentences.english: My sister-in-law sends a gift to you. She asks me to give you it face to face.
sentences.chinese: 我嫂子寄过来一份礼物，让我亲自交给你。

sentences.english: She could consult with her brother, could receive her sister-in-law on her arrival, and treat her with proper attention;
sentences.chinese: 她遇事能同哥哥商量着办，嫂子来了能以礼相待。

sentences.english: Brother got married, my sister-in-law is my first love.
sentences.chinese: 哥哥结婚了，嫂子竟然是我得初恋情人。

sentences.english: My sister-in-law Padmini had sent a plate of rice cooked in coconut milk.
sentences.chinese: 嫂子Padmini送来一盘用椰奶做成的米饭。

sentences.english: Today, we took the kids to the local pond near my sister-in-law's to feed the geese.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们带着孩子们去嫂子家附近的池塘喂大雁。

sentences.english: Sister in law, do not joke, my brother how could it cheating?
sentences.chinese: 嫂子，你别开玩笑了，我哥哥怎么可能会劈腿呢？

sentences.english: The elder woman who had a miscarriage2 did not let anyone know about it.
sentences.chinese: 嫂子小产，却没有让任何人知道。

sentences.english: Sister-in-law always happy to say" silly girl."
sentences.chinese: 嫂子总是幸福的说“这个傻丫头。”

sentences.english: One night, I was on the phone with my sister-in-law, Dawn.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，我正和嫂子打电话。

sentences.english: My sister-in-law is a music teacher in a small school in western Montana.
sentences.chinese: 我嫂子是蒙大拿州西部的一个小学音乐老师。

sentences.english: Little sister 's eyes without a hint of sadness and fear.
sentences.chinese: 小嫂子的眼睛里没有一丝的忧怨与恐慌。

sentences.english: My sister-in-law works for a group that supports orphanages in Cairo.
sentences.chinese: 我的一个嫂子在开罗的一个孤儿帮扶组织工作。

sentences.english: My sister-in-law knew a master of penmanship whose work is expensive.
sentences.chinese: 我嫂子认识一位书法大师，他的作品很值钱呢。

sentences.english: In the picture my sister-in-law my second brother's wife was offering prayers to the God of Earth with chicken blood.
sentences.chinese: 在照片中我的嫂子正在用鸡血向土地之神祈祷。

definition: older brother's wife/sister-in-law/(polite address to a younger married woman) sister
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
wife of older male cousin via female line
older brother's wife/sister-in-law/elder sister (respectful appellation for an older married woman)
older male cousin via female line
big sister/elder sister/older sister (also polite term of address for a girl or woman slightly older than the speaker)
husband of older female cousin via female line
